name: Ottoman Hotel Park

reviews.text: We stayed there for 3 nights on the way South just to see what Istanbul was like. We are two married couples who know eachother well, middle aged but with plenty of life left in us.
reviews.title: Pretty faultless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lets deal with the only fault first, my arthritic ankle that doesn't like hills.
reviews.title: THE IDEAL BASE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel clean, simply and neatly furnished.
reviews.title: Very good hotel.

reviews.text: Room much larger than expected, large comfy bed and required bits and pieces in room. Little or no noise from street.
reviews.title: the best hotel staff we ever had

reviews.text: Restaurant on the roof terrace was a treat whether for breakfast, lunch or dinner; yes we tried them all and there's plenty of variety.
reviews.title: Welcoming and friendly - a good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very customer oriented, wonderful staff very helpful and cheerful. Breakfast was excellent, had wide collection of delicious food to choose from, served in the rooftop restaurant overlooking the Marmara Sea, what a great view to enjoy in the morning. Location is convenient, walking distance to most of the sights. Great sea food restaurants nearby .Rooms are spacious, if you're luck enough to get a room over looking the Marmara Sea, you'll enjoy it.
reviews.title: Smooth stay, extremely pleasent

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel, in room 306, for 4 nights between 27th March and 31st March 2012.
reviews.title: A few minor niggles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had not booked directly with the hotel, so prior to arrival I contacted them by e-mail to ensure that my reservation was OK; I got a reply within a few hours and the offer of paying about 25 Euros to be collected from the airport - pick up is free if you book directly with the hotel.
reviews.title: Pleasant days at Istanbul

reviews.text: On arrival at the hotel I was greeted warmly by the reception staff, check-in was quick and efficient. I was also introduced the the guest relations manager who was very keen to offer tourist advice and provide me with maps, etc. I was shown to my room by Anul who also showed me the restaurant/ breakfast room on the terrace floor which had stunning views over the Sea of Marmara. There was also an outside terrace where meals could be taken subject to the weather.
reviews.title: excellent service

reviews.text: Now to the room itself; it was spacious, well appointed and clean. Bathrobes and slippers were provided. There was also a safe in the room. Tea and coffee making facilities were provided. However, a small bottle of water provided free on arrival was not replaced nor were the sachets of coffee which I used. Whilst buying water is not a problem, there is little point if the coffee is not replenished. The TV was quite large, lots of channels but as per usual the only English language ones were news or business channels. The bathroom was a reasonable size; the toilet was placed at a higher level than I am used to in the UK so felt really uncomfortable; the shower was great and the soap, shampoo etc provided were of good quality.
reviews.title: Good hotel.

reviews.text: Very good hotel. We liked that it was some blocks from the busyiest streets but yet close.
reviews.title: Really good Hotel, we had a perfect time.

reviews.text: The rooftop restaurang and bar had a very nice view over the Blue Mosque and the Marmara See.
reviews.title: Good but not perfect

reviews.text: The rooms very big and well planned with nice furniture and good beds.
reviews.title: We loved the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and helped us with everything we wanted. Couldnt ask for a better service!
reviews.title: Good stay in Istanbul

reviews.text: Good transportservice to and from the Airport.
reviews.title: Would love to go back for more

reviews.text: The first thing you will discover about this hotel is that taxi drivers do not know about it! So, when you get given the card with the hotel's address and location make sure you carry it at all times. Once you arrive you will immediately discover the friendliness and eagerness of the staff. Sitting in the pleasant lobby we got an introduction to the city and its sights from the concierge who puts himself at your disposal.
reviews.title: Turkish delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room (203) was a very spacious corner suite - even with a z-bed for a child it didn't feel cramped. Now, my first minor gripe; while the bed is very wide and comfortable, as a six-footer I found my feet dangled over the edge. There is a nice LCD tv on the wall and surprisingly enough tea and coffee making facilities. I was very impressed with the bathroom; it is spacious and was kept very clean. The roomy shower-cubicle has a handheld shower as well as a lovely rain shower head under which you can sit.
reviews.title: 5 days in Istanbul

reviews.text: Breakfast is served in the roof-terrace restaurant and has all the eating options you could want of a morning. Really nice to sit there and take in the lovely views over the rooftops to the Sea of Marmara.
reviews.title: So well run!

reviews.text: When you want to go exploring you will find that the hotel is only about 10 mins walk from the nearest tram stop and about 15 mins walk from Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia etc.
reviews.title: Very Pleased

reviews.text: Fantastic - the staff could not be more helpful - especially Serhat who helped us with trips and managed to get us accross the Bosphorus to see Fenerbahce play football! Rooms spacious and comfortable and the restauarant/breakfast room on the top floor has great views. Located in the best part of the city (the old town) for the sights and right next to the Kumkapi area with great fish restaurants. If you're not up to the 10 minute walk uphill to the Blue Mosque and the other sights then put your life in your hands and take a taxi from the hotel at only 5 lire (less than £2) - quite an experience as is the rest of the city! Great fun! Great hotel!
reviews.title: A great find!

description: Deluxe and superior rooms have a magnificent view of the Sea of Marmara and they are equipped with a Turkish bath, where our guests can experience a great relaxation. All rooms are spacious and they offer modern amenities such as LCD TV, individually controlled air-conditioning, coffee&tea maker, minibar, safebox, bathrobe, hair-dryer, wireless internet connection, smoke detector and double glazed windows.
